intro: Pleiotaxis huillensis subsp. axillaris, commonly known as the Huillén axillary pleiotaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive veining pattern. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
